decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: 24-010-E00, 24-010-E01, 24-010-E02, 24-010-E03, 24-010-E04, 24-010-E05, 24-010-E06, 24-010-E07, 24-010-E08, 24-010-E09, 24-010-P00, 24-010-P01, 24-010-P05, 24-010-P06, 24-010-P07 and Planning, Design + Access Statement. Received: 12/07/2024
24-010-P02A, 24-010-P03A, 24-010-P04A, 24-010-P08A and 24-010-P09A. Received: 10/09/2024
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - Before the development is first brought into use works above ground level take place, the following boundary treatment shall be erected according to 24-010-P07 on the front boundary and this shall be retained permanently thereafter. 
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and to ensure a satisfactory appearance.
description: Erection of a single storey rear infill extension, removal of horizontal cladding to the front elevation to restore original render and half-timbering, replacement of front and rear upvc windows with timber casement with vertical fenestration, replacement of brick boundary wall, replacement of the entrance steps and removal of upvc porch.
